Please fix the test case, or get one of the co-ops to do it.

In Test.org.eclipse.widgets.Control and Test.org.eclipse.widgets.Widget is used
the test: widget.notifyListener (SWT.Paint, new Event())

This can cause problems for emulated/custom widget that use information of the
event as dimension and GC.

Since the test case model, the custom widget will run these testcases using a
instance of the parent class. (so, there's no problem for the custom widgets so far)

For emulated widgets it's working because they use the events bounds to
determine the area to be paint, since it's the rect (0,0,0,0) there's no paint.
Except for the TabFolder, which code always paint the border doesn't matter the
events bounds.

Is easy to fix this problem by change these testcase stopping using that test,
Still make sense analize why the TabFolder is not using the event bound.
closing. Tests were fixed long ago.
